resources.string: Last Straw is a strategic one versus one battle between you and a computer controlled enemy. The main objective is to accumulate the most points but also to avoid clearing the last object. The game is turn based and each turn you get a set number of moves. Each move you can either clear an object or play a card. Whoever clears the last object and ends the game receives a point penalty, so think through your last couple of turns carefully.

The player and the enemy also has access to cards which can be used to affect the game. There are three different categories of cards. Continue to the next page to learn how to acquire cards, how to use cards, what they can do and see examples.
There are three different types of cards:

Field cards affect the board somehow. For example, you can use a field card to restore cleared objects. Ailment cards are cards that affect the opponent, such as slowing them down or make them miss when they try to clear objects. Boosting cards affects the user of the card in a positive way. For example, you could gain a point or move boost.

You start with only 1 card in your arsenal. However, as you gain levels, you gain access to new cards. You can have a total of 6 cards in your hand while playing, but you start out with 1 available slot.
Additional slots are awarded from achieving victories against more difficult enemies. You can preview all unlockable cards per card type from the main menu if you hit the "Cards" button.

In Last Straw, you will venture through different worlds. These worlds consists of 10 levels. In order to progress, you have to beat each level at least one time. You may play the same level multiple times, however you gain less experience the higher level you are in comparison to the world level-range.

Finally, high score works like this: Every level has its own high score. These all add up to make a world total score. Eventually, when you\'ve cleared multiple worlds, all scores adds up to an account high score.
